required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Open-Label Extension to Assess the Continued Efficacy of Omacor Plus Simvastatin
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label Extension of a Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Crossover Study to Evaluate Simvastatin 20 mg Plus Omacor 4g Compared to Simvastatin 20 mg Plus Placebo in Subjects With Mixed Dyslipidemia

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this trial is to assess the continued efficacy of Omacor co-administered with simvastatin for lowering non-high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (non-HCL-C) levels.

detailed_description.textblock:
The present trial is an open-label, uncontrolled extension to the previous trial (PRV-06009) which utilized a randomized,double-blind, two-period crossover design with eight clinic vists.
The current trial consists of nine clinic visits over 104 weeks. There will be two treatment periods in this study:
- Phase I: All subjects will receive simvastatin 80 md/d plus Omacor 4 g/d for the first six weeks of the trial.
- Phase II: All subjects will receive simvastatin (at a dose to be determined at the discretion of the Investigator) plus Omacor 4 g/d for the remainder of the treatment period.

primary_outcome.measure: The primary efficacy endpoint will be the percent change in non-HDL-C from baseline (average of weeks -2, -1, and 0) of the PRV-06009 double-blind study to Week 6 of PRV-06009X

secondary_outcome.measure: The percent change in non-HDL-C from baseline (average of weeks -2, -1, and 0) of the PRV-06009 double-blind study to week 52 of PRV-06009X open-label treatment
The percent change in non-HDL-C from baseline (average of weeks -2, -1, and 0) of the PRV-06009 double-blind study to week 104 of PRV-06009X open-label treatment

intervention.description: Omacor 4 grams/day plus simvastatin 80 mg/day. Simvastatin dose adjusted at Investigator discretion after week 6.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Must have met all relevant inclusion/exclusion criteria prior to and throughout the previous double-blind study (PRV-06009)
- Must have completed the previous double-blind study to week 12.
- Provide written informed consent and authorization for protected health information
Exclusion Criteria:
- Study drug compliance less than 50% in PRV-06009
- Any ongoing serious adverse event from PRV-06009

responsible_party.name_title: Kevin C. Maki, PhD, Chief Science Officer
